Good morning from the second day of @transalt #VisionZero2016 conf! Today's emcee is @jakedobkin publisher of @Gothamist
Jake is giving us some tips from the media's perspective on how to help raise awareness about traffic deaths #VisionZero2016
First: access to the victim's family helps a fatal crash story break through the noise, just like @NYC_SafeStreets has done #VisionZero2016
Second: find pictures for a story about a fatal crash, helps humanize and emphasize the tragedy of a crash #VisionZero2016 @NYC_SafeStreets
Third: if you're writing a policy piece and want coverage, find the hook and call it out when you send it to the media #VisionZero2016
(And make sure you are illustrating your policy issues, like @bikeyface does so spectacularly! #VisionZero2016)
Fourth: "how-to" items play well with modern media. Like: "how to not get hit by a truck" or "how to not drive drunk" #VisionZero2016
Fifth (second to last, promise): tap into the current zeitgeist when trying to report a story #VisionZero2016 @transalt
Sixth (and final!): alt media like @Gothamist @LAist & @Gizmodo are our friends! Give them stories first! Thanks for the tips @jakedobkin

We're here! @lacbc is excited to take part in today's #MoveEquity chat with @SafeRoutesNow @LAvisionzero & @Visionzeronet. Let's chat!
LA's #VisionZero Alliance is here and ready to talk #MoveEquity! We are a growing coalition working to support and influence the City's work
A1. At best VZ offers an oppty to right many wrongs, from planning to policing, & invest in communities that have been neglected #MoveEquity
Great point!!
A1. VZ data highlights inequities & leads to important convos re: whose lives & which communities have been/will be prioritized #MoveEquity
A2. Ensuring that #VisionZero strategies reflect diverse community concerns, needs, languages, abilities #MoveEquity
A3. Any enforcement strategies thru #VisionZero shld challenge problematic policing practices in low-income POC n’hoods. #MoveEquity
A3. Prioritize education over enforcement to address traffic behaviors; enforcement shld be last resort #MoveEquity
@SafeRoutesNow Would love to hear people's specific ideas for this, top items to prioritize for #VisionZero? #MoveEquity
A4. Advocate 4 enhanced relationship policing initiatives w/in ur community. http://bit.ly/1FvwWYL  #MoveEquity
A4.  Est. forums w/ residents, city reps & PD 2 discuss traffic fatalities & impact of racial profiling, punitive policing #MoveEquity
A5: Community partners diversify the voices represented on the issue. Check out @LAvisionzero #MoveEquity
A5. VZ is personal. It's about social + physical enviro of where you live & how ppl treat you there. It demands community input #MoveEquity
A5. Schools, faith leaders, community dev orgs & transit advocates need a space. More partners = more alignment + power to #MoveEquity
@LAvisionzero created opp 4 advs 2 galvanize @ shared vision 4 street safety & cmmty engagement in LA #MoveEquityhttps://twitter.com/SafeRoutesNow/status/745673104840499201 …
Coalition-building materials wld help: sample agendas, templates & forms, guides for tough convos, etc. #MoveEquity
A6: @LAvisionzero  Ensured CBO's have a seat and a role with city agencies at the VZ0 table. #MoveEquity
A6: @SafeRoutesNow the creation of @LAvisionzero has been the beginning of a success story in #LA & we're happy to be member. #MoveEquity
Q6. As part of @LAvisionzero, @AARPCA assisted in procuring LADOT's adoption of #VisionZero in its strategic plan #MoveEquity
A6. Challenge: Helping ppl realize that writing tickets alone wont change behaviors, esp in communities already targeted by PD #MoveEquity
A6. Opportunity: @LAvisionzero bringing diverse orgs to the table to reach different populations @YPIusa is happy to be a member #MoveEquity
A6. Success: Elevating the voices of community members & ensuring that engagement is more than a checked box #MoveEquity
A7. Help city staff develop guidelines for & conduct in-language, culturally humble and competent community engagement #MoveEquity
A7. Keep recruiting unlikely allies! Esp those w/ experience developing relationship btwn community & police #MoveEquity
THANK YOU to our co-hosts @Visionzeronet and @LAvisionzero #MoveEquity

Panel incl @LAPDHQ officers, lifelong Angelenos, bicycle attorney, Sergeant overseeing millions in traffic safety funds among others! #squad
Panel convo starts with attorney Jim Pocrass discussing the cases he receives and info on police reports AKA #primarycollisionfactor
Next, @LAPDHQ officers Lurvey and Cullen shed light on the officer training & assessment at the scene of the collision
.@LASDHQ Ofc Tang chimes in discussing the "collision investigation manual," which guides a police or sheriff officer's report
This manual is meant to standardize data collection, and is published by @CHP_HQ, also called "Form 555"
Correction! Ofc. Tang is with @CHP_HQ. @LASDHQ is represented by Sgt Hill
Going to turn off twitter and focus on conversation - very riveting info! Check back with @lacbc for a blog write-up of evening
"Ask an officer" event just wrapped! A lot of info covered. 3 thematic takeaways from our perspective:
1) "Measure what you treasure" - all law enforcement agencies mentioned a need for better data collection
.@LAPDHQ discussed their investment in a digital records management system, which will better capture and report collision/citation data
2) Community trust is EVERYTHING. @CHP_HQ discussed their shift away from citations to warnings, prioritizing education over enforcement
3) Grow the Team! @LASDHQ discussed LA County's new Vision Zero focus, and all agencies discussed need for more training
All that, & much much more! Look out for @lacbc blog post, and BIG THANKS to @LAvisionzero & all their partners for putting on a great event

What does "VDM safety should focus on PEDS not cars" mean to you?
PEDS are a non issue Monday-Friday before 9 am. So, changing lanes is a sledgehammer solution to a scalpel problem.
It means making VDM safer for PEDS by getting them to Dockweiler parking, which is dedicated, safer, and easier to control.
IMO, 354 crashes that caused major injuries is not a scalpel problem
That's where we disagree. Society has to have a balance between perfect safety and efficiency.  We don't make anything perfectly safe.
So, if the goal is perfect safety, then the means would be banning cars (and nobody is suggesting that).
The number of accidents cannot be the motivation for creating gridlock.  If it was, then the 405 would be one lane.
The question, legally, is whether the old VDM created an unreasonably dangerous condition for the public.  I don't think it did.
I would agree with your assessment of where we disagree.
300+ accidents, considering the number of cars traveling the road, and the number attributable to PEDS negligence, doesn't warrant this chng

Whoa, "PED negligence"?

You're the lawyer here. You really want to go there?
Number 1 cause of death of children in LA is to be killed by a car. Solving that problem is important and will involve patience or sacrifice
Comparative fault. I'm a defense lawyer so I will go there for sure.  Nobody can protect against someone doing something dangerous.
Agree 100%.  There was and is a problem.  I don't believe that this was the right solution, that's all.
We should also note that the number one cause of death of children in the entire country is traffic accidents.  This isn't an LA problem
This isn't *just* and LA problem, I should say

Fault is mostly important for insurance matters and traffic fines. @VisionZeroLA asks how we can make roadways more tolerant of mistakes. 1/
We make roadways tolerant for drivers, in many ways. When a driver loses control of a car and crashes into a light pole, it snaps away. 2/
The light pole falls, perhaps endangering pedestrians, but we don't ask who was a fault. We have made the roadway more tolerant.
We cut down trees to give drivers more room, and then they crash into houses. 4/
We widen roads to speed up travel times, and then crashes become increasingly more deadly. 5/
But in these cases, we don't ask about fault. We don't ask about drivers speeding. We want to tolerate fault. We want to save lives.
@VisionZeroLA wants to extend these same principles to vulnerable street users. We may disagree about where or when we do it. 7/
But with the rash of pedestrian/cyclist deaths, we cannot ignore that they need streets more tolerant to fault -- by anyone. end/
